indicator_name: Whether or not legal frameworks are in place to promote, enforce and monitor equality and non‐discrimination on the basis of sex
SDG_GOAL__GLOBAL: Goal 5: Achieve gender equality and empower all women and girls
SDG_TARGET__GLOBAL: Target 5.1: End all forms of discrimination against all women and girls everywhere
SDG_INDICATOR__GLOBAL: Indicator 5.1.1: Whether or not legal frameworks are in place to promote, enforce and monitor equality and non‐discrimination on the basis of sex
SDG_CUSTODIAN_AGENCIES__GLOBAL: UN Women, World Bank (WB), Organisation for Economic Co-operation and Development (OECD)
SDG_GOAL: Goal 5: Achieve gender equality and empower all women and girls
SDG_TARGET: Target 5.1: End all forms of discrimination against all women and girls everywhere
SDG_INDICATOR: Indicator 5.1.1: Whether or not legal frameworks are in place to promote, enforce and monitor equality and non‐discrimination on the basis of sex
STAT_CONC_DEF: Gender pay gap is based on the percentage difference between median wages. The workplace population in a local authority is defined as the population whose usual place of work is in that local authority, including individuals who live and work in the local authority and individuals who work in the local authority but commute from a home elsewhere within England or Wales. The resident analysis refers to those who reside in the local authority, however the workplace does not have to be within the same local authority.
